entry.title: Diary 19/03/2020
Test bank OS
entry.content:
Test 1 (Chapter 1, 2)

  1. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the response time of P4 ?
    Answer: 7

  2. Which is INCORRECT about process control block (PCB)?

    • PCBs in all operating systems are the same
    • It is a data structure containing information of a process
    • It contains the state of the process
    • It contains memory management information

  3. Which is INCORRECT about preemptive in CPU scheduling algorithms

    • The current process can be switched into ready state
    • The current process can be switched into waiting terminated state
    • The current process will always be run until terminated
    • The current process can be switched into waiting state

  4. Which is INCORRECT about non-preemptive in CPU scheduling algorithms?

    • FIFO is a non-preemptive scheduling algorithm
    • The current process will always be run until terminated
    • Only the current process can use the CPU Incorrect (Incorrect)
    • The current process can be switched into waiting state

  5. Which is INCORRECT about an application?

    • It serves a certain task for users or programmers
    • It can be organized into multiple files on disks.
    • It controls I/O (such as read/write operations on disks)
    • A database management system is an example of an application

  6. Which module should NOT be implemented in the kernel of operating systems?

    • Process management module
    • Device drivers (such as network card device drivers)
    • Memory management module
    • Networking module

  7. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the turnaround time of P1 ?
    Answer: 7

  8. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) CPU scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Which is the average waiting time of the processes?

    • 5
    • 3
    • 2
    • 4

  9. Which is NOT one of the main tasks of operating systems?

    • Protection and security
    • Play audio files
    • Storage management (such as CD, DVD, disks, …)
    • Memory management

  10. Suppose a system uses FCFS CPU scheduling algorithm, the processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,21), P2(30,10),P3(20,40), P4(40,25). Calculate the average waiting time of the processes?
    Answer: 15.75

  11. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the turnaround time of process P4 ?
    Answer: 12

  12. Which is NOT an operating system type?

    • Uni-programming operating system
    • Sequential system
    • Embedded system
    • Batch system

  13. Which is CORRECT about the task of CPU scheduling?

    • Select a process to change into idle state Incorrect
    • Select a process to initialize
    • Select a process to swap out
    • Select a process to execute

  14. Suppose a system uses Round Robin (RR) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,21), P2(30,10), P3(20,40), P4(40,25), and the time quantum is 15. Show the order (e.g. P2, P1, P3, P4) in which the processes are run?
    Answer:

  15. Select the best description about the resources a computer may have

    • CPU, RAM, Disk, printer
    • CPU, RAM and anything that can connect to the computer, such as CD, network card, …
    • CPU, RAM, Disk, printer, monitor
    • CPU, RAM, Disks

  16. Select the best description about what a pure computer (a computer without an operating system) can do

    • Provide applications and network connection for users
    • Provide applications for users
    • CPU can do arithmetic calculation, detect available devices such as RAM, disks, …
    • Provide graphical user interface

  17. Which is NOT an operating system structure?

    • Object-oriented
    • Layered Incorrect
    • Micro-kernel
    • Modularity

  18. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Which is the turnaround time of process P2 ?

    • 8
    • 6
    • 10
    • 12

  19. Suppose a system uses FCFS CPU scheduling algorithm. The duration and order of processes are P1(21), P2(10), P3(6). Which is the throughput of the system?

    • 0.3
    • 0.1
    • 0.4
    • 0.2

  20. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the response time of process P3 ?
    Answer: 3

  21. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the turnaround time of process P4 ?
    Answer: 12

  22. Which is NOT a criterion to evaluate a CPU scheduling algorithm?

    • CPU utilization
    • RAM utilization
    • Response time
    • Waiting time

  23. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Calculate the turnaround time of P1 ?
    Answer: 7

  24. Which is preemptive CPU scheduling algorithm?

    • SRTF
    • SJN (or SJF)
    • None of the above
    • FIFO

  25. Which is non-preemptive CPU scheduling algorithm?

    • None of the above
    • Round robin
    • FIFO
    • SRTF

  26. Which is INCORRECT about the criteria to evaluate a good CPU scheduling algorithm?

    • Maximize turnaround time
    • Maximize throughput Incorrect
    • Minimize waiting time
    • Minimize response time

  27. Which is non-preemptive CPU scheduling algorithm?

    • Round robin
    • None of the above
    • SRTF
    • FIFO

  28. Which is INCORRECT about Shortest Remaining Time First (SRTF) scheduling algorithm?

    • It is also a priority scheduling algorithm
    • The shortest remaining time process will be selected to run
    • The shortest process will be run first
    • It is the preemptive Shortest Job First (SJF) algorithm Incorrect

  29. Which is the INCORRECT process scheduling type?

    • Quick-term scheduler
    • Short-term scheduler
    • Medium-term scheduler
    • Long-term scheduler

  30. Suppose a system uses Round Robin (RR) CPU scheduling algorithm, the processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,21), P2(30,10), P3(20,40), P4(40,25), and the time quantum is 15. Calculate the total waiting time of the processes?
    Answer:

  31. Suppose a system uses SJN (or SJF) scheduling algorithm. The processes information (arrival time, duration) is P1(0,7), P2(2,4), P3(4,1), P4(5,5). Which is the turnaround time of process P2 ?

    • 10
    • 8
    • 12
    • 6

  32. Which is INCORRECT about batch system?

    • Is a simple operating system
    • May use FIFO mechanism
    • Is not like time-sharing system
    • Allow many people to use a computer concurrently

  33. Which is INCORRECT about process control block (PCB)?

    • It contains the state of the process
    • It is a data structure containing information of a process
    • It contains memory management information
    • PCBs in all operating systems are the same

  34. Which is INCORRECT about time-sharing system?

    • Only utilize CPU effectively
    • It is also applicable for multiple CPU hardware
    • Utilize resources more effectively
    • Allow several processes to run on a single CPU hardware

  35. Which is CORRECT about the structure of a process?

    • Heap, data, code (text)
    • Stack, heap, data, code (text), program counter, and addtional information
    • Stack, heap, code (text)
    • Data, code (text)

Test 2 (Chapter 3, 4)

  1. Given the following code, with the globally shared variable int buf, and count() is a function. Which is incorrect when multiple instances of the code are running in the system?

    • The critical section should be the lines marked: 1, 2, 3, 4
    • There is a critical section in the code.
    • There is a race condition in the code.
    • The critical section should be the lines marked: 1, 2, 3 Incorrect

  2. Which is correct value of FINISH and WORK vectors during the running of the deadlock detection algorithm?

    ALLOCATIONREQUESTAVBALABLE
    PROCESSABCABCABC
    P0010000000
    P1200202
    P2303000
    P3211100
    P4002002
    • FINISH=(T, T, T, T, T), WORK=(7, 2, 6)
    • FINISH=(F, T, T, T, T), WORK=(5, 1, 2)
    • FINISH=(T, T, T, T, T), WORK=(7, 2, 4)
    • FINISH=(F, T, T, T, T), WORK=(7, 2, 5)

  3. Given the following system information, and process P4 requests (1, 0, 0) more resources: Which is the correct value of FINISH and WORK vectors during the running of Banker’s algorithm which is called in the Resource-Request algorithm (to avoid deadlock)?

    ALLOCATIONMAXAVBALABLE
    PROCESSABCABCABC
    P0010753332
    P1200322
    P2301902
    P3211222
    P4002433
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, T), WORK=(2, 3, 2) Incorrect
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, T), WORK=(3, 3, 2)
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, F), WORK=(2, 3, 2)
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, F), WORK=(3, 3, 2)

  4. Which is INCORRECT about Resource Allocation Graph (RAG)?

    • A rectangle represents a process
    • A circle represents a process
    • An edge from a resource vertex to a process vertex represents an instance of the resources is allocated to the process
    • A request edge is from a process vertex to a resource vertex

  5. Which is the correct output of the banker’s algorithm:

    ProAllocationMaxAvailable
    ABCABCABC
    P0001001152
    P1100175
    P2135235
    P3063065
    P4001065
    • P0 P2 P4 P3 P1
    • P0 P2 P1 P3 P4
    • P0 P1 P2 P3 P4
    • The system is not in the safe state

  6. Which is INCORRECT about Inter-process communication (IPC)?

    • IPC can be used to handle critical section
    • IPC can be used for data communication
    • IPC can be used to synchronization Incorrect
    • IPC can be used for memory management

  7. Which is incorrect about Semaphore?

    • We can manipulate the semaphore’s integer directly.
    • Semaphore includes an integer and two atomic operators.
    • wait (or P) operator is corresponding to ENTRY in the protocol of a critical section
    • signal (or V) operator is corresponding to EXIT in the protocol of a critical section

  8. Given the two bellow processes sharing three semaphores full, empty, mutex, and a buffer buff having initial N empty slots: Which is incorrect about semaphore empty?

    • It is a counting semaphore.
    • The maximum value of empty is N.
    • The minimum value of empty is 0.
    • The minimum value of empty is -1.

  9. Which is incorrect about the protocol to run a critical section CS?

    • Sometimes it is not needed to call EXIT;
    • Critical section CS should be the smallest code.
    • The call to ENTRY may cause the process to wait.
    • ENTRY is responsible for asking to run the critical section.

  10. Which is the correct goal of the progress condition of critical section?

    • maximize CPU utilization Incorrect
    • maximize disk utilization
    • maximize the shared resource utilization
    • maximize RAM utilization

  11. Which is INCORRECT about deadlock detection algorithm based on graph?

    • If there is a cycle, the system is in a deadlock state
    • An edge from a vertex to another one means a process is waiting resource which is held by the other process
    • Vertices of the graph represent processes Incorrect
    • Vertices of the graph may represent processes or resources

  12. Given the following system information, and process P2 requests 1 more tape: Which is the correct value of FINISH and WORK vectors during the running of Banker’s algorithm which is called in the Resource-Request algorithm (to avoid deadlock)?

    PROCESS TAPESALLOCATION TAPESMAX TAPESAVAILABLE
    P05103
    P124
    P229
    - [ ] FINISH=(F, F, F), WORK=(4)
    - [x] FINISH=(F, T, F), WORK=(4)
    - [ ] FINISH=(F, F, T), WORK=(5)
    - [ ] FINISH=(F, T, F), WORK=(5)

  13. Suppose table Sales has a column monthly_amount, and one row of which stores the sum of daily transactions of a month. For each transaction we use the following SQL for updating the row: UPDATE Sales SET monthly_amount =monthly_amount + sum_transaction() WHERE month=m and year=y; When multiple users generate this SQL at the same time with the same m and y, which is incorrect?

    • The database management system needs to do nothing special to ensure the correct result.
    • The database management system is responsible for synchronization to ensure correct result.
    • There is a race condition in this situation.
    • There is a critical section in this situation.

  14. Given the following system information, and process P1 requests 1 more tape: Which is the correct value of FINISH and WORK vectors during the running of Banker’s algorithm which is called in the Resource-Request algorithm (to avoid deadlock)?

    PROCESS TAPESALLOCATION TAPESMAX TAPESAVAILABLE
    P05103
    P124
    P229
    • FINISH=(F, T, F), WORK=(5)
    • FINISH=(F, F, F), WORK=(4)
    • FINISH=(F, F, T), WORK=(5)
    • FINISH=(F, T, F), WORK=(4)

  15. Given the following system information, and process P1 requests (1, 0, 2) more resources: Which is the correct value of FINISH and WORK vectors during the running of Banker’s algorithm which is called in the Resource-Request algorithm (to avoid deadlock)?

    ALLOCATIONMAXAVBALABLE
    PROCESSABCABCABC
    P0010753332
    P1200322
    P2302902
    P3211222
    P4002433
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, T), WORK=(7, 3, 3)
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, F, F), WORK=(7, 4, 2)
    • FINISH=(F, F, F, T, F), WORK=(7, 3, 2)
    • FINISH=(F, T, F, T, F), WORK=(7, 4, 3)

  16. Given the following resource allocation graph, which is correct?

    • There is a cycle containing a claim edge, thus there is no deadlock. Incorrect
    • There is a cycle in the graph, thus there is a deadlock.

  17. Given the code of Readers-Writers problem: Which is the initialized value of the mutex variable in the above algorithm?
    Process writer P:

    Process reader Q:

    • 0
    • -1
    • NULL
    • 1

  18. Which is not Interprocess Communication?

    • A web browser views a webpage from a web server.
    • A process reads data from a file.
    • A php page in a webserver connects to a Database Management System (such as Microsoft SQL Server)
    • A process shares a semaphore with another process.

  19. Which is incorrect about the protocol to run a critical section CS?

    • The critical section may need to wait in some situations.
    • ENTRY always returns immediately.
    • ENTRY is responsible for asking to run the critical section.
    • Critical section CS should be the smallest code.

  20. Given the following resource allocation graph. What is the correct name of the edge from R1 to P1?

    • Assignment edge.
    • Request edge.
    • Claim edge.

Test 3 (Chapter 5, 6)

  1. Given the 1-level page table of a process as bellow, with the frame size=1KB. Calculate the physical address of the logical address 4982? (e.g. 18932 or error)

    FRAMEVALID
    041
    1120
    251
    3230
    4511

    Answer: 53110

  2. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 8 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 3/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 24.2 micro seconds
    • 27.2 micro seconds
    • 26.2 micro seconds
    • 25.2 micro seconds

  3. Which is INCORRECT about priority (memory) allocation?

    • It can prevent thrashing from occurring
    • Frames are globally allocated
    • It cannot prevent thrashing from occurring
    • High priority processes are allocated first

  4. Which is incorrect about inverted page table?

    • The process identifier must be also included in the table
    • The number of entries in this page table equals the number of frames
    • This page table maps frame numbers to page numbers of running processes
    • We can not detect page fault in this scheme

  5. A system uses Translation Look-aside Buffer (TLB) for address translation in paging (1 level page table). Suppose the access time of TLB is 20ms; the access time of the memory is 200ms; and the hit rate of TLB is 85%. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 260 ms
    • 240 ms
    • 250 ms
    • 230 ms

  6. Given the reference string: 7 0 1 2 0 3 0 4 2 3 0 3 2 1 2 0 1 7 0 1. Suppose the system uses FIFO page replacement with 3 frames. Show the order of pages that are selected as victims to be swapped out (e.g. 7 0 1 2 0 3 0)?
    Answer: 7 0 1 2 3 0 4 2 3 0 1 2

  7. A system with 2-level page table in the form of (p1, p2, offset), and the content of page table No 2 of level 2 is: {(612, v),(14, i),(123, v),(5, v),(756, i)}. Suppose the frame size is 4KB; the address register is 32 bit, the number of bits for level 2 (p2) of the address register is 10. Given a reference =8395272, calculate its physical address, e.g., 12764 or Page fault?
    Answer:

  8. Suppose a paging system has the page fault rate=0.08%; the memory access time is: 250 nano seconds; and the page fault handling time is: 7 milli seconds. How many times the performance is slowdown? (eg. 87).
    Answer: 23

  9. Suppose a system uses FIFO page replacement algorithm with 3 frames. Given the reference string: 1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, show the pages (in appearing order, e.g. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5) that are selected as victims to be swapped out?
    Answer:

  10. A system with 2-level page table in the form of (p1, p2, offset), and the content of page table No 0 of level 2 is: {(27, v),(213, i),(87, v),(826, v),(92, v)}. Suppose the frame size is 4KB; the address register is 32 bit, the number of bits for level 2 (p2) of the address register is 10. Given a reference =13134, calculate its physical address, e.g., 12764 or Page fault?
    Answer:

  11. Which is INCOREECT about memory protection in paging?

    • This ensures the page corresponding to a reference is loaded into the memory before accessing
    • This ensures a reference always points to a location in memory
    • This ensures a process always accesses to locations within its memory space Incorrect
    • This ensures a process never refers to an invalid memory location

  12. Suppose a system uses second chance page replacement algorithm with 6 frames. The values of the reference bits of the frames are 1 1 0 1 1 0. The current position of the pointer is at 2nd frame. When the page replacement is called, show the values of the reference bits (e.g. 1 1 0 1 1 0)?
    Answer: 1 0 0 1 1 0

  13. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 6 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 3/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 17.2 micro seconds
    • 20.2 micro seconds
    • 19.2 micro seconds
    • 18.2 micro seconds

  14. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 7 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 1/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 6.2 micro seconds
    • 7.2 micro seconds
    • 8.2 micro seconds
    • 9.2 micro seconds

  15. Suppose a system uses paging (1-level page table) with the frame size of 8KB; the address register is 32bits. Which is the CORRECT split of the address register?

    • (page-offset)=(20:12)
    • (page-offset)=(21:11)
    • (page-offset)=(22:10)
    • (page-offset)=(19:13)

  16. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 7 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 3/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 22.2 micro seconds
    • 21.2 micro seconds
    • 23.2 micro seconds
    • 24.2 micro seconds

  17. Given the 1-level page table of a process as bellow, with the frame size=1KB. Calculate the physical address of the logical address 1286? (e.g. 18932 or error)

    FRAMEVALID
    0971
    1980
    231
    3561
    4611

    Answer: error

  18. Given the reference string: 1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Suppose the system uses Least Recently Used (LRU) page replacement algorithm with 3 frames, calculate the total page faults?
    Answer: 10

  19. A system with 2-level page table in the form of (p1, p2, offset), and the content of page table No 2 of level 2 is: {(27, v),(213, i),(87, v),(826, v),(92, i)}. Suppose the frame size is 4KB; the address register is 32 bit, the number of bits for level 2 (p2) of the address register is 10. Given a reference =8398178, its physical address is?

    • 357730
    • 3384674
    • 378210
    • 111970

  20. Which is INCORRECT about fragmentation?

    • There are two types: internal and external fragmentation
    • It can lead to a situation where a process cannot run though the total free memory is greater than the process size
    • It leads to less effective memory utilization
    • There is no fragmentation on disks

  21. Which is incorrect about MFT?

    • This memory allocation method causes internal fragmentation
    • The memory for applications is divided into a number of partitions when the system boots up
    • This is a memory allocation method which is widely used in current operating systems
    • The size of the memory partitions may be different when the system boots up

  22. Which is the reason why a process can run when only a part of it is loaded into memory?

    • Because only one instruction is executed at a time
    • Because related instructions are always in the same group
    • Because we can indicate which instructions to run
    • Because instructions of a process are independent

  23. Which is INCORRECT about paging (1-level page table)?

    • Pages are of equal size
    • Virtual space is also divided into pages
    • Page size is equal frame size
    • It is a contiguous memory allocation method

  24. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 9 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 1/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 9.2 micro seconds
    • 8.2 micro seconds
    • 6.2 micro seconds
    • 7.2 micro seconds

  25. Suppose a paging system has the page fault rate=0.3%; the memory access time is: 250 nano seconds; and the page fault handling time is: 7 milli seconds. How many times the performance is slowdown? (eg. 87).
    Answer: 85

  26. Suppose a paging system has the page fault rate=0.08%; the memory access time is: 150 nano seconds; and the page fault handling time is: 7 milli seconds. How many times the performance is slowdown? (eg. 87).
    Answer: 38

  27. Suppose a segment table with the following rows of (base, limit, valid): {(1432823, 1236, v), (876530, 8364, v),(3898764, 2894, i),(14987378, 45288, v),(2876906, 9862, i)}. Given a reference (s, offset)=(0, 894), identify its physical address?

    • 1433717
    • 3899658
    • 14988272
    • 2877800

  28. A system uses proportional memory allocation method. There are 3 processes in the system: P1, P2, P3 with the size of 138KB, 96KB, and 164KB, correspondingly. Suppose the memory size is 180KB, and the frame size is 2KB, calculate the number of frames allocated for processes P1, P2, P3 (e.g. 23:34:12)?
    Answer:

  29. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 8 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 3/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 25.2 micro seconds
    • 26.2 micro seconds
    • 27.2 micro seconds
    • 24.2 micro seconds

  30. Suppose a system uses paging on demand without a Translation Look-aside Table (TLB). The memory access time is 200 nano seconds; page-fault service time is 6 miliseconds; page-fault rate is 2/1000. Which is the Effective Access Time (EAT) of the system?

    • 13.2 micro seconds
    • 14.2 micro seconds
    • 15.2 micro seconds
    • 12.2 micro seconds

  31. Given the 1-level page table of a process as bellow, with the frame size=1KB. Calculate the physical address of the logical address 4982? (e.g. 18932 or e
    rror)

    FRAMEVALID
    041
    1120
    251
    3230
    4541

    Answer 53110

  32. A system with 2-level page table, the frame size is 4KB; the address register is 32 bits, the row size of the page table is 4 bytes; the address register is divided into (p1, p2, offset) for fast address translation (no need to use multiplication and addition for calculating the physical address). Given a reference =8398178, the corresponding (p1, p2, offset) is, e.g., (12, 12, 12)?

    • (1, 2, 256)
    • (1, 3, 256)
    • (1, 0, 256)
    • (2, 2, 256)

  33. Suppose a system uses segmentation memory allocation. The content of the segment table (limit, base) of a process is [(1000, 1400), (400, 6300), (400, 4300), (1100, 3200), (1000, 4700)]. Calculate the physical address of the reference (4, 402) (e.g. a number or invalid)?
    Answer 5102

  34. Given the reference string: 7 0 1 2 0 3 0 4 2 3 0 3 2 1 2 0 1 7 0 1. Suppose the system uses Least Recently Used (LRU) page replacement algorithm with 3 frames. Calculate the total page faults?
    Answer 12

  35. Suppose a system uses paging (1-level page table) with the frame size of 4KB; the page table of a process is [56, 120, 3]. Which is the physical address of the reference (1, 196)?

    • 120*1024+196
    • 3*4096+196
    • 560*4096+196
    • 120*4096+196

  36. Suppose a system uses contiguous memory allocation with the following information: the base address is 13400; the limit register is 1200; and a reference is 1246. Which is the result of the Memory Management Unit (MMU)?

    • 1446
    • 14646
    • An error
    • 14154

  37. Suppose a system uses proportional allocation based on the size of the processes. There are two processes A and B with the size of 10 and 127 frames, correspondingly. The memory size if 64 frames, calculate the number of frames allocated for A and B (e.g. 23:17)?
    Answer: 5:59

  38. A system with 2-level page table in the form of (p1, p2, offset), and the content of page table No 2 of level 2 is: {(612, v),(14, i),(123, v),(5, v),(756, i)}. Suppose the frame size is 4KB; the address register is 32 bit, the number of bits for level 2 (p2) of the address register is 10. Given a reference =8407560, its physical address is?

    • 14996354
    • 885506
    • Page fault
    • 3907740

  39. Given the 1-level page table of a process as bellow, with the frame size=1KB. Calculate the physical address of the logical address 7289? (e.g. 18932 or error)

    FRAMEVALID
    041
    1120
    251
    3231
    4511
